title: Verb collection 2
sentences: What time are you coming to my house this afternoon?
I always bring my own lunch to work.
de la oficina a las seis.
We leave the office at six.
They return from their holidays tomorrow.
The movie starts in ten minutes.
mi tarea y luego juego un rato.
I finish my homework and then I play for a while.
What are you looking for inside your backpack?
Finally I find my keys in the drawer.
Can you help me with this very heavy box?
I'll wait for you at the cinema door.
Today I feel a bit tired.
I don't remember his/her name; it's very difficult.
I always forget the umbrella when it rains.
Can you open the window, please?
I don't know how to cook paella yet.
a mi primo el que vive en Madrid?
Do you know my cousin who lives in Madrid?
a tu madre por su cumpleaños?
What are you telling/saying to your mother for her birthday?
ese ruido extraño en el jardín?
Do you hear that strange noise in the garden?
From here I see the television very well.
I like to look at the stars at night.
What is your new dog called (named)?
The train arrives ten minutes late.
Are you carrying/taking enough money for dinner?
Shall I put (serve) you a bit more water?
Will you take off my coat, please?
al tercer piso por la escalera.
We have to go up to the third floor by the stairs.
Be careful when going down the mountain; it's dangerous.
en la tienda a mirar ropa?
Do you want to enter the store to look at clothes?
I want to order a pizza for dinner today.
Will you give me some of your chocolate?
dictionary:
Venir - To come
Traer - To bring
Salir - To leave / To go out
Volver - To return
Empiezo / Empezar - To start
Terminar - To finish
Buscar - To look for
Encontrar - To find
Ayudar - To help
Esperar - To wait
Sentirse - To feel
Recordar - To remember
Olvidar - To forget
Poder - To be able to / Can
Saber - To know (info/skill)
Conocer - To know (people/places)
Decir - To say / To tell
Oír - To hear
Ver - To see
Mirar - To look at
Llamarse - To be named
Llegar - To arrive
Llevar - To carry / To take
Poner - To put / To serve
Quitar - To take off / To remove
Subir - To go up
Bajar - To go down
Entrar - To enter
Pedir - To ask for / To order
Dar - To give
